page.title: 08YOUTH OF 1985
page.content: KATE RAMBRIDGE takes a humorous look at the girls of today. This being a girls' school, it is easy to list several characteristics unique to schoolgirls of this age. Most teenage girls seem to have a morbid fixation for Howard Jones or some other microphone-ridden young man; some carry this passion further than others! The school uniform restricts the young ladies preferred strange appearance (eg. luminous pink socks, two foot long earrings and truly horrific tee-shirts) except in the mighty sixth, where they parade in whatever they please, doing their level best to ignore all the other years. Teachers are a strange lot too. Gone is the age of strict, grey-haired mistresses, but a few relics have survived beside the dynamic new breed.
